column5: Hi.  I want to take my son fishing again. He wants to go on the boat and catch some fish :-)  Was wondering if there are any decent places to camp and boat. just looking for a few small bass to keep the little one interested.  The ideal place would be a campground (I have a trailer) that we could stay at, preferably right on the waterfront.  Thanks all!
What area are you looking at?
Ooops, I guess I should have answered this...Probobly 3 - 4 hours outside of toronto would be great.
Try the premium sites at Restoule. Camped there last year and it was great! Good fishing, beach right at the campsite and a ton of places to explore.  Here are some pics of the campsite
3-4 hours awat from the big smoke?  you can find hundreds of places.  With a little one i would keep to the smaller lakes.  Som provincial parks offer great camping and fishing  cheers!
I'm going to second Restoule you and your son will love it

I just did one on the long weekend with my son and friend and his son for their first tenting trip. We weren't sure how they would take to it so we found a camp rsort with amenities, we stayed at Golden Beach on Rice Lake. They have all the extras there in case he gets bored on the water,and have good boat rentals if you need one. Plenty of Bass and panfish in Rice Lake, just drag a worm and you will do fine. Next one will be a little further north and more of a bush camping experience seeing as they reacted quite well to the tenting aspect.
here's a list (site) to help you out.  http://www.ontarioparks.com/english/sr2.html
Thanks all. Im looking into restoule, though its a bit far for a 3 day trip.  I've planned to visit there anyway, so I may just bite the bullet and go. Any other tips welcome.
bass lake provincial park or Six mile
3-4 hours from the gta gets you to restoule. I have been going there for 20 plus years,great camping and fishing,I am heading there on thursday for a 2 week stay.
Bass Lake great little lake & lots of Bass SBK
